edu.stanford.facs.logicle
Class FastLogicle

java.lang.Object
  edu.stanford.facs.logicle.Logicle
      edu.stanford.facs.logicle.FastLogicle

public class FastLogicle
extends Logicle

A fast implementation of the Logicle data scale and its inverse. This version is substantially faster than the more general implementation but will throw a LogicleArgumentException if the arguments are outside of the normal scale range 0 <= scale < 1.0. It should provide suitable speed and resolution for real time graphical applications.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Wayne A. Moore

intScale

public int intScale(double value)
Looks up a data value in the internal table. Provides a fast method of binning data on the Logicle scale

Parameters:
value - a double data value
Returns:
the bin for that data value
Throws:
LogicleArgumentException - if the data is out of range

inverse

public double inverse(double scale)
Computes the approximate data value corresponding to a scale value. This method uses linear interpolation between tabulated data values.

Overrides:
inverse in class Logicle
Parameters:
scale - a double scale value
Returns:
the double data value
Throws:
LogicleArgumentException - if the scale is out of range

inverse

public double inverse(int index)
Returns the minimum data value for the specified bin

Parameters:
index - a bin number
Returns:
the double data value
Throws:
LogicalArgumentException - if the index is out of range

scale

public double scale(double value)
Computes an approximation of the Logicle scale of the given data value. This method looks up the data in the table then performs an inverse linear interpolation.

Overrides:
scale in class Logicle
Parameters:
value - a data value
Returns:
the double Logicle scale value
Throws:
LogicleArgumentException - if the data value would be off scale
See Also:
Logicle.scale(double)
